    format(String) - Method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate
    Formats this date using the given pattern
    format(DateTimeFormatter) - Method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate
    Formats this date using the pattern of the given formatter

    Note that calling formatter.format(date) will typically result in an error, as this method does not actually utilize the given formatter, rather it simply extracts its pattern and produces its output using its own implementation
    from(TemporalAccessor) - Static method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate

    getDayOfWeek() - Method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate
    Gets the numeric value for the day of the week of this Date

    Following the conventions of ISO 8601, Monday has a value of 1 and Sunday has a value of 7 Leap days belong to no week and therefore have a value of 0
    getDayOfYear() - Method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate

    M

    minus(long, TemporalUnit) - Method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate
    NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results.

    NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results.
    MJD_EPOCH_OFFSET_IN_DAYS - Static variable in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalChronology
    The difference, in days, between an Epoch Day and a Modified Julian Day (MJD).
    ModernDigitalChronology - Class in net.xmercerweiss.mdc
    The Chronology class implementing the Modern Digital Calendar system

    Exclusively implements datekeeping, meaning attempting to work with time-based classes (such as LocalTime, LocalDateTime, or Duration) or values (such as ChronoUnit.HOURS) will typically throw an UnsupportedOperationException
    ModernDigitalDate - Class in net.xmercerweiss.mdc
    Represents a specific date within the Modern Digital Calendar system

    Note that attempting to work with time-based values using this class is an error; see ModernDigitalChronology
    ModernDigitalEra - Enum Class in net.xmercerweiss.mdc
    The eras of the Modern Digital Calendar system as enumerated constants

    The Modern Digital Calendar only has 2 era, Before Epoch and Since Epoch, with the epoch being 1970 ISO.
    MONTHS_PER_YEAR - Static variable in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalChronology
    The number of months in each year; always 13

    N

    net.xmercerweiss.mdc - package net.xmercerweiss.mdc
     
    NON_LEAP_DAYS_PER_YEAR - Static variable in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalChronology
    The number of non-leap days in each year; always 364
    normalizePeriod(ChronoPeriod) - Method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalChronology
    Returns a copy of this ChronoPeriod with each unit normalized to the values used within this Chronology

    Years are assumed to be 365 days long regardless of how many leap days would occur over a number of years.
    now() - Static method in class net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate
    Creates a new ModernDigitalDate instance representing the current date at runtime
